name: D Boyd
text:
I was looking for a central location to meet a relative on the eastern part of the state to hit a bucket of balls. I live a couple of hours away from Piedmont, as does my relative.
A Google search turned up this range, but I had a difficult time finding anything else about it, even if it was operational. There was one review, and a Dec 2019 facebook reference to a new ball dispensing machine. I tried calling the city and left voice messages, but no one called back.
I visited yesterday and found that it is maintained by Piedmont Parks and Recreation (or whatever they call themselves). It is located off highway 21 in the sports complex, adjacent to the swimming pool. For this size town, I felt like the range is very nice and a good place for general swing practice.

The good about the place:
Nice open area with good parking
Hitting area is level with reasonably good mats
Fairly new ball dispensing machine
Range extends for 250 yards
Cost is $2 for 25 balls, which are in good shape!

Areas for improvement:
No bathroom facilities
Range is an undulating up-hill (some prefer flat)
Dispensing machine requires dollar bills (go prepared)
No close targets (chipping!)
No putting area

I am surprised that no one at the city has “claimed” this location on Google maps. It would also help attendance to get this location added to the golf resources web sites for Alabama.

I enjoyed my visit until my dollar bills were exhausted ($12 worth). The up-hill angle of the range encouraged me to get under the ball. Probably helped my practice!

While it may not be perfect, I appreciate the City of Piedmont for their efforts to construct and maintain this facility!

name: Art Of Valor
text: Awesome place to drive golf balls down range. Very relaxing and relieving of stress.

name: rebecca young
text:
Awesome hospitality and service !!
Chris and Your Crew are Awesome !!
*****

name: Lucas Kuykendall
text: Very good course

name: C Sim
text: Peaceful course, and nice people. Wear a collared shirt, and you'll have a great time. Cart path needs a lot of work, but other than that 4/5

name: Justin Watford
text: I've played worse but for $40 I expected more. Extremely friendly and professional staff (I give them and the clubhouse 5 stars) The course needs a lot of work. Greens were in terrible shape and sand traps were basically clay pits with grass growing. There is hardly any signage throughout the course which can be a pain to navigate if you've never been. I heard nothing but good things about this course but once we got past the first hole it was in rough shape.

name: Dan G
text: Inexpensive and a decent course. Friendly staff and great wings.

name: George Yinger
text: Wow not what expected shame it has potential but needs lots of work.

name: Ivan San Inocencio
text: Best course in my opinion love it

name: Dave N
text:
Poorly maintained in desperate need of work on the grounds
The greens are quite bad and the tre boxes are dried out mud flats
The layout is decent but no care has been taken to bring the course up to par .

name: Benjamin Bean
text: I have been going there every so often since they opened up last summer. The people who work there are always helpful and friendly. There prices are fair and affordable. They offer loaner clubs if you do not have your own for FREE. They also have a pool table inside along with serving food and drinks, alcoholic beverages also.

name: Blake chappell
text: This bar / hitting range golf balls is very fun to go to specially on Saturday nights and Monday nights they have karaoke and trivia on Saturday and music and trivia on Monday buy Bryant Clonts.The staff is very welcoming and fun to be around and have an amazing food there Burger is something to look forward to. Highly recommend you try it out.

name: Rick Holliday
text: Love this place, owners and helpers very friendly ,good food must have the burger inch thick patty (also have your favorite beverage or drink )It not just a place to hit a ball

name: Jason Phillips
text: Great place! Had lots of fun. Family friendly until 8 pm.

name: Scherrie Letherwood
text: Amazing staff,food was hot and delicious,you can even sit on the back porch,and watch people ,hit the balls off the tee.

name: April Bishop
text: Everyone was so nice.  Bathrooms were very clean,  staff was very friendly.

name: Shelton Walker
text: Awesome bar keep. Y'all need to visit ESPECIALLY during Karaoke!

name: Delaney McCurdy
text: Excellent service.. Excellent food.. Excellent Place!!

name: Leslie Willey
text: The staff is very friendly and greets everyone who walks in the door.

name: Kenneth Riddlespur
text: Awesome place and great people!

name: Steven Carter
text: Great food and fun

name: Andrew Lewiski
text: Fun

name: Cassandra cote
text: Come check us out

name: Daniel Wilson
text:
Good experience. $10 for 100+ balls.
5$ for 50ish.

The guy working there was nice and helpful. Balls were in pretty good shape. They treat the area for mosquitos as well.

name: Wesley Higgins
text: Our Boy Scout troop came out for an hour of fun!

name: ROBERT TUNNELL
text: Went a couple weeks ago... well maintained and wide open.

name: Case Bryant
text: It's coming along nicely.

name: Landon Peterson
text: The owners are extremely nice and very accommodating. Are used to go there a lot as a child and honestly had forgotten it was there but I am so glad that I found it again. I will definitely be back.

name: Austin Hulgan
text: Love it very nice,I go everyday it's open,you got lots of room and love the place

name: Chris Reed
text: Nice place and staff seems great 👍 👍

name: Tampa Duncan
text: Easy to find,  nice staff plenty of room for my slice.

name: Scott Barrentine
text: New ownership!

name: Peter
text: We had a great time here. The host made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in the door. He was a great ambassador for Xgolf  I will definitely stop back in when in the area.

name: Terence Johnson
text: This is a great place that everyone should take the opportunity to visit if you're in Huntsville. It's not too big to get lost in other customers. The staff (Rod) is very helpful, friendly, and does everything he can to help. It's one of the best golf simulation venues that I've visited.

name: Nathan Coffman
text: Decent for bar food, good selection of beer, and golf sims with 22 courses + Driving range for a fair price.

name: Hopeful Nerd Overlord
text: Amazing place. Samantha is a great bartender

name: Hope G
text: Its a little pricey but really was worth it. My husband and I had a great time and our waiter was extremely friendly. We will be going again and looking forward to taking a lesson there next week. I could be very wrong about it being pricey though. I don't golf so there prices may be very normal..

name: Stefanie Mcclure
text:
Such a great place to go when you want to practice your golf game! Especially when it’s raining!!
Lashawnda provides excellent service even when this place is completely busy!

name: Michael Henderson
text: Cool place. Rod was super nice and helpful. Would go back just to hang out with him.

name: D Boyd
text: Nice indoor practice area.

name: Dawn Fields
text: Having a great ladies day experience. Golf instruction was just what I needed. Relaxed environment. Great for experienced and novice golfers. So.much.fun!!

resp.text: We're thrilled you learned a lot and had a fun time doing it, Dawn! Thanks for coming out to see us -- we're looking forward to your next visit. -X Golf Management

name: Zac Peterson
text: Badass place. It was hard as hell doing it for the first time but super fun anyways. Cool staff

name: Robert Mims
text: Had a good time. Lots of fun once you get use to the short game .

name: John majane
text: Nathan is very knowledgeable and friendly!

name: Craig Dailey
text: It's fun, but not as realistic as you'd hope.  Also a bit expensive.

name: Michael Hesse
text: Still working out some bugs in the software, but fun place.

resp.text: Thanks for coming out, Michael! We're always working hard to improve the experience here, and we hope you notice that improvement next time. -X Golf Management

name: M B
text: Great place, had fun but they need food!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed stopping by, Vic! We serve food, as well as beer and wine in our bar area. Hoping you'll be back soon. -X Golf Management

name: Haley Buie
text: Such a fun place for experienced and new golfers!

resp.text: Thanks, Haley! We appreciate the review. We'll see you next time. -X Golf Management

name: Josh Evans
text: Awesome place great prices

name: Louis Mitchell
text: Was impressed, clean, friendly and fun

resp.text: We're glad we exceeded expectations, Louis! Thanks for stopping by -- hope you make it back here soon. -X Golf Management

name: Chip Carter
text: Great fun

name: Mark Johnson
text: Great place to golf!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the support, Mark! We hope to see you again soon! -X Golf Management

name: Morris Lauderdale
text: Great

resp.text: We're happy that you enjoyed stopping by, Morris! We hope you'll be back our way again soon. -X Golf Management

name: Tim Aper
text: I got to play Pebble Beach!  They took time to explain and made sure I enjoyed the experience.  Great staff!  Thank you

name: Joe Marstrell
text: My favorite driving range in the area. The range balls are always in good shape and staff is friendly and helpful. I’ve got good deals from Nick buying new and used golf equipment and took a few lessons from Joey.

name: Caleb Aho
text: Bought a rangefinder from the pro-shop and the guy (nick) was very professional and quick to respond. was able to find an option that was in my price range and didn't try to up-sell my which is very much appreciated. Highly recommend if not for the prices, then for the quick responses and professionalism. Thanks Nick!

name: Justin Davenport
text: I've been playing golf nearly 20 years and I have never hit the ball well. I finally decided to take a lesson. Joey was an excellent teacher! He was patient, friendly and explained things in a way that was easily comprehensible. He fixed everything in my swing and had me hitting the ball straighter and further than I ever have and with the least amount of effort I've ever put into a golf swing. At $45 for an hour including balls I feel like I stole that lesson after what he was able to give me in an hour. He didn't do a bait and switch lesson. He didn't just show me a few things to work on and told me to come back so he could make more money on me. He showed me everything to fix my swing and just told me to practice. I will definitely be back to see him though. Joey put a confidence in my swing I never thought was possible.

name: Paul Llewellyn
text: Great place to relax or let off steam. Better yet practice your golf swing.

name: Jim and Sniffers
text: Awesome place to unwind and awesome friendly folks recommend it 100% also have club repair and regriping only $5,$7,and $10 for a large bucket of balls credit or cash awesome place also golf lessons offered by instructor Joey Burgoon and David Lewis and Nick Powell club repair

name: Juan Cepero
text: Got into golf over the summer and this is easily my favorite range to hit at in the area. Staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, range is well up kept, and I always have a great time. If you're needing help with your swing, a new club, or repair these guys do it all and you won't be disappointed!

name: Mike J
text: Excellent shop with great people!

name: Blake Lang
text: First time visit today first thing noticed nice shop good service the range was clean but way to many objects in the field markers are spread out instead of running down center lots of mounds with signs on top blocking view of balls hit past 150yards would be way better with a nice flat field with markers

name: Bobby Wendell
text:
Weather shelter a good addition if raining...
Good value. Good to veterans.
I'll be back.

name: Miguel Mello
text: Shop guys very friendly and always there to help with any questions about the game of golf.

name: 18Flea
text: Great driving range, inexpensive. Can get a great lesson, too!!

name: Brian rosenthal
text: Great service plenty of room for year round practice

name: Kathy W
text: Took Grayson and Cole to hit golf balls

name: Jesse Hollingsworth
text: Very pretty course with great scenery. The greens here are some of the toughest greens I have ever experienced. If you are up for a challenge, this is a neat course to play.

name: Kim Melton
text: We had my niece's baby shower at Cumberland today and it was super nice. The place has amazing views and Veronica runs the place top notch!

name: r b
text: My first time there and I was impressed..Veronica is a very good manager...she is on top of the flow of players..

name: Brian Tolzman
text: Veronica was great!  The course was in rough shape. They did have bad weather however don't think that affected the conditions though.

resp.text: Not a correct assessment.  Condition and layout, one of the best in the area at this price point.

name: jullie hallman
text: Beautiful

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Mike Hamner
text: Really nice course, fairways and greens were very playable, challenging layout. Will definitely want to play it again.

name: Michael Dennis
text: Love it such a nice place to hang out and supper friendly  staff!!!

name: Jackie Aronhalt
text: My husband golfed 2 rounds here and loved it! I enjoyed the huge (amazingly clean) pool, food, drinks and view. Awesome!

name: Daniel Banks
text: Great little course. Played it while in Birmingham on business. Greens were a little slow, but rolled smooth. Fantastic layout. Will play again next time in town.

name: Jane Aronhalt
text: New ownership has made amazing turn around. Beautiful course. Love the views. Looking forward to booking a group event.

name: David SMith
text: Course is looking really good! They seem to be making a lot of improvements. Best deal in town at $23 on Tuesdays!

name: Brandon Shirah
text: Love the layout. Course was bought by a group of people and since then they have let the course go a little bit. New new groundskeeper to take pride in the course.

name: Homer Marlowe
text: By far in the best shape it has ever been in thanks to a  new grounds keeper  sent from heaven an new managers that are looking out for the members a great place to jone

name: Parker Cantrell
text: 19th hole has some of the sweetest people around. Worth the trip

name: Lavador Sizemore
text: Beautiful golf course, i worked at this golf course back in 1996 and 97 alot of good memories!

name: Terry Crane
text: Greens are fast. Course in good shape

name: Byron Dixon
text: Very friendly staff. Great rates.

name: Harrison Jones
text: Nice place.

name: J D
text: Nice facility. Clubs available, cold drinks, and good folks.

name: Tim Jones
text: Outstanding people and a great range to practice

name: John Purvis
text: Great people

name: Lisa McDonald
text: I just attended a 3-day, 2-night girls' camp with 12 girls from 11 to 18 years, in addition to 5 other adult leaders.  Susan and Ron were absolutely wonderful to work with from the time we booked our adventure until we drove away.  Susan was very accommodating when we needed to change our schedule and quickly responded to all questions.  The girls loved the zipline, pool and lake activities as well as all of the team-building games and competitions we did, and Ron was kind enough to open the water slide which was not scheduled. The accommodations and food were great and Susan even sent us home with extra muffins!  We would definitely go again!

resp.text: Lisa, thanks for the great review.  We really enjoyed having your group here and hope to see you again.

name: David Norris
text: This was just what we were looking for! They accommodated our zip lining group ages 5 to 86 and everyone was safe and it was fun! Ron, Susan and entire staff are great. Hidden gem.

resp.text: Thanks David.  We really enjoyed your group yesterday.   Hope to see you again.

name: Sara Thompson
text: These was such a great adventure to do as a family. We stop on are way done to Florida and we are so glad we did. We did the tree adventure and zipline but we wish we could have spent more time there. Diffently take the time to stop.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting Butter and Egg Adventures.  We hope that your visit was just one of many great times your family will have while on this trip.  We thank you for stopping by and having some fun with us.

name: Charles uh60m
text: What a great place this is! My kids and I just left there and had a blast! There is so many fun things to do but I have to say zip lining was the best!

resp.text: Charles, thanks for bringing your family here yesterday.  We could tell they were having a great time.  Look forward to seeing everyone again.

name: Erin Shae
text: SO MUCH FUN! Can't wait to go back and try even more...we were there with a school group and were able to zipline, rockclimb, canoe and paddle boat, shoot eachother with lazer guns on the Battlefield (totally beat my own kid's team 😁), and eat our lunches under a covered pavillion...it was great. The staff interacts well with the kids and everybody was helpful and informative. Considering it for this year's birthday!

resp.text: Thanks for the great comments and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Xhilyn
text: My friend saw your billboard on the highway and the name itself warrants such a good review. Cheers, - Bethany Rae Jackson

resp.text: Thanks, if you liked the billboard...you would love the facility.  Come out sometime and enjoy our adventures.

name: zion michelle
text: so fun!! i went eith my cousins

resp.text: Zion, thanks for coming to Butter and Egg Adventures!

name: Randy Nix
text: My grandchildren had a blast and the employees are were  great with the kids

resp.text: Randy, thanks for the 5 Star review.  We really enjoyed having your family here today.  Thanks for coming to Butter and Egg Adventures!

name: DandK
text: It was one of those thing on my bucket list  we was down there for a state tournament  baseball game  . So we 2 grandmother's we wanted to do something fun and we did it was the best we laughed we was scared caused we never done it laughed at each other we loved it I will stop every  time I come threw and thank y'all for letting 2 grandmother's have a great experience   . Darlene Zills.

name: Marty Parson
text: Awesome time, they are well organized and want you to have good time

resp.text: Thanks Marty.  Hope to see you again.

name: Ashley Creekmore
text: Took my Girl Scout Troop here for a 3-day weekend. They loved it!  The food was great and the staff was amazing. They were extremely knowledgeable and friendly. They went above and beyond for us. We definitely got more than our money’s worth with this camp and will likely come again. The zip lines and tree adventures with high ropes course were the girl’s favorite. But the human foosball was equally fun. So many good memories made that weekend.

resp.text: Thank you Ashley, we really enjoyed having your group here!

name: Kristen Piazza
text: Went here for my birthday and had an awesome time! 😍 Went ziplining and axe throwing. 🪓Natalie and her husband were super awesome guides! They wear masks the whole time so if you're worried about Covid, don't be. Definitely go here you will not regret it!

name: sherita newby
text: GREAT place, with a GREAT staff. I hurt myself and they took very good care of me!! I will definitely be back!!

name: Dawn Burley
text: Awesome place great staff love the property!

name: k9krate
text: Great experience

resp.text: Thanks for coming to Butter and Egg Adventures.  Hope to see you again!

name: Mollie Waters
text: Loved it!

resp.text: Molly, thanks for visiting Butter and Egg Adventures.   Glad that you had a great time!

name: Kayla F
text: We had such a fun group ! The guides were friendly and explained everything well. Natalie was a great guide and they were so accommodating of all skill sets. Can't wait to go again

name: Mary-Aileen McLemore/ Anti-Cook Girl
text: My boys (12 and 14) and I had a fantastic time! This is by far the most creative tree course we've done. The zips were the best too- lots of them for long distances unlike other places that only give you one or two of those in your package. You also can't find a better price out there for this type of adventure. We will go back!

resp.text: Thanks for taking on our three tree courses!

name: Mary-Aileen McLemore/ Anti-Cook Girl
text: My boys (12 and 14) and I had a fantastic time! This is by far the most creative tree course we've done. The zips were the best too- lots of them for long distances unlike other places that only give you one or two of those in your package. You also can't find a better price out there for this type of adventure. We will go back!

resp.text: Thanks for taking on our three tree courses!

name: Amanda Kelley
text: My daughters came to camp there July 11th through the 13th for kids camp with Crossroads Baptist Church. They came with $20.00 a piece to purchase anything of their choosing. The Adults that we’re in charge of both of my daughters money made them share $20.00. With that being said neither of my daughters were able to purchase a shirt from your camp. Not happy because we live over 2 hours away. It would be nice if y’all were able to make it to where your shirts can be purchased from your website.A staff member was very rude to my oldest daughter had I been there it wouldn’t have happened. If your staff can’t be nice to children then they don’t need to work for the camp period. I’ve heard great things about your camp. But after what happened with my daughters makes me see different.

resp.text: Amanda, we are sorry that your daughter had a bad experience at Butter and Egg Adventures.  We work hard to make sure all of our guests are treated with dignity and respect.  With that in mind, to find out more about the situation of a staff member being rude to your eldest daughter, please call 334.670.9954 or 334.670.9953 to discuss with us.  We need to find out more information, so that we can act accordingly.  On your other matter about buying a t-shirt, we had no control of your daughter's money and on how to spend it.  We certainly want to sell t-shirts to all our guests.  Our primary purpose for our website, is to provide information about our services and recreational opportunities at Butter and Egg Adventures. If you would like to buy a t-shirt at this time, please let us know and we can make arrangements to sell you one via our payment gateway.  We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Ana A
text: My daughter, her boyfriend and I went to Butter and Egg Adventure the day after New Year's Day. It was the first sunny day in weeks and we really enjoyed getting out and being active. The owners, Ron and Susan, were gracious enough to take us through the course themselves, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The grounds, structures and property are well maintained and good safety procedures are in place. We hope to return in the Spring with a bigger group of family and friends. Perfect for a family outing or activity for a big group of friends or venture groups.

name: Mrs. Rose
text: My family and I visited Camp Butter and Egg this past summer and we had a blast! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's interested and having a ton of fun. There were various activities available for both adults and children. In addition, the staff was very welcoming and showcased excellent customer service.

name: Joe Sherwin
text: I took 17 members of our leadership team here for a staff ride where we focused on teambuilding, communication, and critical thinking skills.  Susan and Ron provided an excellent environment and program to engage our staff.  From the Escape Room to the confidence courses to the zip-lining, it was a top-notch experience.  We look forward to coming back in the near future.  Great investment!

resp.text: We enjoyed having you experience our facilities and look forward to seeing you again.

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
This place has so many fun things to do. We took a group of almost 300 people and they accommodated us well. Everyone was very helpful as far as explaining the climbing gear, how to work the ziplines and laser tag. Our lunch was hamburgers and they tasted very good and the kitchen staff did a great job of moving everyone along.

The only reason this is not a five star review is that we had several from our group complain that some of the staff were rude and not friendly, almost like they really didn't want to be there. The majority of the staff went above and beyond to help us out and for that we are very thankful.

I don't remember the young lady that helped us at the climbing wall in the beginning, but she was probably the best there that day. She was very nice and understanding to our group, and the majority of them had never climbed before so that was great.

Also, Ron took a group picture with his drone for us and all the kids loved it.

Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone for an event or just a fun weekend with the family.

name: halee dix
text: Dix Family Thanksgiving has been at Camp butter &a Egg Adventures for the last 4 years. Some of us zip line and we all play laser tag on the battlefield.  The owners are so sweet. Family owned and operated. Great place for family reuinions or just a small family day of fun.

name: Brandon Stephens
text: We have been bringing our preteens here for a 3-day 2-night retreat for the last 6 years. This year we decided to do two trips and bring two different groups. Butter & Egg is A+. The friendly staff and top notch facilities make it a prime destination for budget conscious families and groups looking for fun and adventure in a safe exciting environment. Can't wait until our next trip.

name: Christie Brantley
text: Idk who is in charge of this place but there is a girl by the name of Bethany (I think) who was so extremely rude to my children the last time I came in... she was SO unprofessional and I can’t believe she would ever be allowed to work with children................ I used to come here all the time... never again. I would not recommend this place to anyone especially someone with children. Please take my advice... she was grouchy, rude, and disrespectful. Never again.

resp.text: I am sorry that your children had a bad experience here.  Please provide some information, as to the date and event they were here for.  My email address is ron@butterandeggadventures.com.  This will allow me to further research this matter.

name: Meagon Underwood
text: Loved it! This is definitely a place to be entertained for hours! Ron and the B&E staff are on point!

resp.text: Meagan, we enjoyed sharing our “Fun Place” with you guys!  Thanks for coming.

name: MaryAnna Lushbough
text: It was really fun. Had a high ropes corse and a  HUGE zip line over a pond. I went on a trip with my jrotc group with 30 other cadets and we all had a blast. The only complaint was the bunk beds are extremely squeaky. Other than that was a great place and a wonderful surroundings.

name: Elysse McKenna
text: The zip lining course was amazing! My youth group also participated in some laser tag at Butter and Egg Adventures and had a great experience!

name: Nathan Harrelson
text: Had a great time with everyone from our group, and a lot of cool stuff to do however, the staff could've been more friendly and happy that we were there. The majority of their staff was very rude, beginning with the main guy in charge.

resp.text: Wow, we don't get too many 1 Star Reviews at Butter and Egg Adventures.  I am sorry that your experience here yesterday, was not good.  We take all of our reviews seriously and we will address your concerns.  Here is my cell phone number, if you would like to discuss your concerns (334-670-9953)

name: drake rollins
text:
By far the most fun place in Troy !
Shoutout to Mr. Ron and Mrs. Susan for being awesome. Great Place !

name: Charles Nelson
text: Went with a group of friends to do the new Escape Room. Kept me on my toes and brought out the detective in me. Wonderful experience and helped me connect closer with my friends.

resp.text: Charles, we are glad you and your friends tried out our Escape Room.

name: Jared Bonebrake
text: Cub Scout Pack 156 from Prattville AL took us to Butter and Egg Adventures and we had a blast.  At the end they asked the kids what they liked best about the day and they all started yelling out Ziplining, Laser Tag, The Giant Swing...  Then they started getting confused, wait, I liked it all.  We'll definitely be back next year!

name: Yvonne Cary
text: Had a great time with the kids of Morningveiw elementary

resp.text: Thanks for coming to Butter and Egg Adventures and having some fun!

name: Scott Martin and Jill Moore
text: It is so much fun!  Excellent facilities, lots of options, and the staff is awesome.

name: Khadija Neely
text: Troy University softball visited today and it was an success !! Can't wait to go back !

name: Lilly Bright
text: we used it as a team bonding weekend and it worked. we stepped out of our comfort zone and trusted each other.

name: Greg Smith
text: Excellent service and good guys to golf with.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Greg.  We hope that you’ll play again soon!

name: Stefània Davis
text: Always a fun course to play. The cart paths are a little rough though.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Stefània.  Come back to see us, soon!

name: jmoakley1
text: This is without a doubt the best golfing experience you can get for your money. Located in Centreville, Alabama, the course features 18 holes located along the banks of the pristine Cahaba River. Established in 1966, CFCC features both old style crowned greens, varied topography and challenging holes. Located 40 minutes from Hoover and 30 minutes from Tuscaloosa, it is easy to get to and fun to play.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We hope to see you soon!

name: Tanya Brumett
text: We attended a birthday party at the pool. Great facilities, but watch the stepdown from the restroom. It is not clearly marked, and several people took a nasty spill.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Tanya.  We painted a strip.  We appreciate you!

name: Mark Lewis
text: The lady in the pro shop was very courteous and very energetic. I think her name was Holly

resp.text: Thanks for your review, Mark!  We hope that you will visit us again soon!!

name: Lisa Franklin
text: Great place to play golf. The people are very welcoming and so friendly! I highly recommend this place!

resp.text: Thanks Lisa!  We appreciate your business!!  :)

name: Lloyd Walling
text: Cahaba Falls is a good course to play when you just want to enjoy some down time. Check it out

resp.text: Thanks Lloyd.  We hope to see you again soon!

name: holiangela
text: Great facilities

resp.text: Thanks for your review.  Come visit soon!

name: D Boyd
text: Fun place to practice for a duffer!. They have worked to improve the hitting mats. Plenty of targets to aim for, even if they are sheet metal, car or 55 gal drum! 😊 The dispensing equipment has not been maintained and the quality of the golf balls has declined. Called the owner and he expressed no interest in making improvements. Says the location is about to close when he opens up east on 72 towards Madison

name: wendy ogle
text: Good prices on bucket of balls. Lots of targets to practice your aim. Fun fun fun

name: Patrick Servat
text: Very convenient. I  wish the yardage markers were a little easier to see

name: Mark Lott
text: Glad to see that new tees have been added.

name: Bear Down Chicago Bears
text: Great place! The owner told me today that he is updating several things as I got a bucket of brand new balls for the range

name: Tucker Ziegler
text: Go to this driving range very often! Lots of objects to hit for everything from driving to chipping! Not very pricey!

name: Jake Jones
text: Fair prices and decent range. Be sure to read all the directions when paying and getting balls. It is not intuitive at all.

name: frank brabo
text: Paid $10 for a large bucket and only got 2 balls, on a Saturday machine was empty

name: Bronson Warren
text: Paid $10 with a card to get 102 balls and I got 9 balls instead. I am not sure how to go about getting my money back but this is extremely disappointing as I drove 20 minutes out here.

name: Tim Massey
text: Good place to practice.
